How to look, or at least feel, like a complete fool – Part 2

Posted by raymondlewallen on February 19, 2007

An extension of this, how many of you would have spent more than 5 seconds debugging why this won’t compile?

public string Hello
{
    return null;
}

I spent 5 minutes.  This is what happens when you spend too much time switching between VB and C#.  I feel like I’m my very own DailyWTF lately.

This entry was posted in .Net Development. Bookmark the permalink. Follow any comments here with the RSS feed for this post.
← How to make a complete fool out of yourself
Controller != code-behind →

3 Responses to How to look, or at least feel, like a complete fool – Part 2

  1. Dan says:
    February 21, 2007 at 6:16 am

    I’ve managed to do something similar, but other way around:

    Public Static Function Create() As Whatever
    Return Nothing
    End Function

    Repeatedly *sighs*, but luckily it was only the first time it took me a couple of minutes before I stopped trying to get the VB compiler to work again and just fixed it.

  2. Derik Whittaker says:
    February 20, 2007 at 12:47 pm

    Agreed, been there done that. How about this one, I have done this before.

    SomeObjectType myObject = null; // Need to set this later, but not sure with what yet.

    ….. more logic goes here ….

    if ( myObject == null )
    {
    throw new Exception( “For Some reason, the object was null” );
    }

    I have spent more then 5 minutes on this type of bug. Turns out that i had not finished the code the night before and when i returned to it the next day i forgot that i have not finished……

    Doh.
